divs: sighting detailsi had just finished playing my little leauge game for the "lions" in pomona california,...i was about ten years old and many of my teamates and their parents were headed back to our cars to go home because the lights to our ball field "ted green" had just shut off, but it takes a few minutes for them to glow down in intensity,...as the lights turned off it makes a sound and the lights go dim,...and dimmer,...when the sounds went off a older parent said "hey" look at that!!! pointing to the sky in the west,...it's a star getting brighter and brighter,...larger and larger,... but then it explodes in the sky,....small tiny white lights evenly spreadout throught out this small explosion in the sky roughly about 1 and a half inches in diameter in the evening sky,...it exploded in slow motion and even through-out,... pure white surrounded by a dark blue evening sky,...it took about a minute to get brighter and larger and then the explosion took about 30 seconds long and then it took another 2 minutes 30 sec to finaaly disappear in the evening sky,...everyone young and old stood their in amasement,...about 2 and a half minutes into this event an edlerly parent said " your witnessing some that happened millions of years ago and it's (the light) now just reaching our planet at this very moment",...years later when i attended usc film school i asked my professor about this event and he said "know one has ever caputered or seen with their own eyes a star going into super nova,...a star blowing up" ,... has never been seen with the naked eye,...i wondered whether he was wrong or whether this was a rare accurence,... it looked just like a star blowing up thats why i believe this ederly man that told us all it was a star blowing up,...it look like it,....thats how it would be seen in the sky for sure,...does anyone have a explanation for this accurence,...
